title: How to Make a Paper Knife

steps.title: Find an 8 ½ in (21.5 cm) by 11 in (28 cm) sheet of printer paper.
steps.content: Find an 8 ½ in (21.5 cm) by 11 in (28 cm) sheet of printer paper. Ordinary printer paper will do. Notebook paper is too thin for this object.

steps.title: Fold the top right corner over to the left edge of the paper.
steps.content: Fold the top right corner over to the left edge of the paper. Do it so the top edge of the paper lines up with the left edge of the paper. The folded portion will form a triangle, with a rectangular piece remaining along the bottom. Make sure the edges line up and that you run your fingers along the crease you've created. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Cut the rectangular shape from the bottom.
steps.content: Cut the rectangular shape from the bottom. Use a pair of scissors to cut the rectangular shape that is left over on the bottom of the paper. Then unfold the triangle to reveal a square-shaped piece of paper. You will use this paper to make a blade for your knife. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Fold the paper lengthwise at least 3-4 times.
steps.content: Fold the paper lengthwise at least 3-4 times. This will create a blade that is at least 1- 2 inches (2.5-5 cm) thick. The paper should now look like a stick. [3] X Research source [4] X Research source

steps.title: Cut a slanting edge on one end of the paper.
steps.content: Cut a slanting edge on one end of the paper. Cut a slanting edge on one end of the paper that makes the paper resemble a sharp kitchen knife. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Staple the blade together.
steps.content: Staple the blade together. Just staple the blade in the center and at the top edge to hold it together. [6] X Research source You can even color the staples with white-out if you'd like to hide them more. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Make the handle from the remaining paper.
steps.content: Make the handle from the remaining paper. The handle should be about 1 inch (2.5 cm) longer than the slanted part of the blade. Measure and cut the excess paper from Step 3 to the appropriate length, and then fold it to the width you prefer for your handle.

steps.title: Staple the blade and the handle together.
steps.content: Staple the blade and the handle together. Just cross the handle over the blade, about 2 inches (5 cm) away from the flat end of the blade. Then, staple the two together at the point where they intersect. [8] X Research source [9] X Research source

steps.title: Enjoy your paper knife.
steps.content: Enjoy your paper knife. You can paint your knife silver, decorate it, or make more paper knives to keep it company.
